title: How to Stop an Application from Opening at Startup With Mac OS X

steps.title: Open the Apple Menu .
steps.content: Open the Apple Menu . Click the black Apple icon in the upper-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click on Users & Groups.
steps.content: Click on Users & Groups . It's near the bottom of the dialog box.

steps.title: Click on the Login Items tab.
steps.content: Click on the Login Items tab.

steps.title: Click on the application you want to stop from opening at startup.
steps.content: Click on the application you want to stop from opening at startup. The applications are listed in the right pane of the dialog box.

steps.title: Click on ➖ beneath the applications list.
steps.content: Click on ➖ beneath the applications list. The application will be removed and will not run the next time you launch your Mac.
